conclusion: A drives in from the lower-right direction where a group of blocks and a car are placed.
The image shows red cubes, orange blocks, yellow cubes, green cubes, blue cubes, and a yellow toy car placed on a green surface.
The red cubes are positioned closest to the lower-right corner where A enters.
As A enters from the lower-right, it first reaches the loose red cubes that are sitting closest to its straight-line path.
The red cubes are very light and are pushed aside almost immediately upon contact with A.
The slight loss of speed caused by contact with the red cubes is not enough to stop A, so it continues moving.
The orange blocks are lying flat and positioned further along A's path after the red cubes.
A reaches the pair of orange blocks after passing the red cubes.
The orange blocks are heavier than the red cubes and absorb most of Aâ€™s remaining kinetic energy.
The collision with the orange blocks causes A to turn slightly to the left.
After the second impact with the orange blocks, A has very little speed left.
A rolls only a short additional distance after the collision with the orange blocks.
The yellow toy car is positioned slightly to the right-hand side of the scene, near the center-bottom.
A comes to rest just in front of the stationary yellow toy car, slightly to its right-hand side.
A does not touch the yellow toy car or the upright stacks of cubes behind it.
Objects touched by A: red cubes first, then the two flat orange blocks.
Final stop position of A: a few centimetres in front of the yellow toy car, roughly in the centre-bottom of the scene, with the car pointing slightly toward the left.
